name: Pragmatic programmer
author: Andrew Hunt & David Thomas
review: The book does not present a systematic theory, but rather a collection of tips to improve the development process in a pragmatic way. The main qualities of what the authors refer to as a pragmatic programmer are being an early adopter, to have fast adaptation, inquisitiveness and critical thinking, realism, and being a jack-of-all-trades.[5]

name: Clean code
author: Robert Martins
review: Even bad code can function. But if code isn’t clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are lost because of … - Selection from Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship [Book]
